text: GOOD NEWS: I secured more than $2.7M in Congressionally Directed Spending for the Town of Kermit from @EPA for a waterline replacement & rehabilitation project. This project will help provide a reliable water source for Mingo County residents. MORE: sen.gov/LOJO

The three major bank failures earlier this year are a stark reminder that American consumers and small businesses are reliant on the stability of the US banking system. I'm proud to introduce bipartisan legislation to strengthen confidence in our banks. sen.gov/JM55
I’m pleased to see these steps from PHMSA and MVP to reaffirm that they are working together to meet all safety standards.

WATCH: It is an honor and a privilege to help fulfill one of Woody’s final wishes in Huntington today and honor the families of those whose loved ones died during military service. And doing so on what would have been his 100th birthday made it all the more special.

Today would have been Woody Williams’ 100th birthday, and he gave us a beautiful day for today’s dedication of the newest Gold Star Families Monument in Huntington. Though Woody is no longer with us, I’m honored to carry on his legacy of serving our Veterans & their families.

WATCH: This administration is trying as hard as they can to implement a version of the #InflationReductionAct that never passed. Even Republican energy leaders have admitted the IRA "balances diverse, complex & overlapping considerations".

We cannot continue to govern this way & must commit ourselves to finding long-term, bipartisan & bicameral solutions to the serious concerns dividing us like our national debt, our border security & the geopolitical responsibilities we have to support democracies around the world

I’m relieved cooler heads have prevailed and we were able to comprise to keep the government open. Our commitment to Ukraine remains resolute and we will find a path forward to ensure our support for Ukraine continues.

GOOD NEWS: I'm proud to announce more than $5.8M from @TheJusticeDept to strengthen public safety throughout West Virginia — including supporting our local law enforcement, reducing violent crime, and advancing critical forensic science research. MORE: sen.gov/ORM1

#ICYMI: The Ohio River Valley in WV & OH has produced the steel that built America into the superpower it is today. We must protect these critical manufacturing jobs. I’m glad @SenSherrodBrown joined me in Weirton this week to thank steelworkers for continuing this proud legacy.
Judge Tabit was a bright light in the Charleston community and we are praying for her family, friends, and the many people whose lives she has touched as we mourn her loss.

Judge Tabit was always guided by fairness and compassion, and has been a role model and mentor for many aspiring lawyers throughout our state. But more importantly, she was a beloved daughter, sister, aunt and friend to so many.

Gayle and I are heartbroken to learn of the passing of Kanawha County Circuit Judge Joanna Tabit. Judge Tabit led a distinguished legal career, including as a judge of the Thirteenth Circuit Court in West Virginia, where she has served since 2014.

I am so thankful to Senator Feinstein for her years of public service and Gayle and I are praying for her family, friends, staff and the people of California as we all mourn the passing of this icon of American politics. My full statement:

#ICYMI: For 234 years, every Senator that has had the honor of serving in the Senate has assumed there were some basic written rules of decorum, conduct and civility. My bipartisan resolution with @SenatorRomney codifies the long-standing practice into a Senate Rule.

WATCH: As the steel industry continues to rebound & reinvigorate itself, we must protect it against illegally dumped & subsidized imports to ensure we retain & grow steel jobs across the country. I was proud to join @SenSherrodBrown in Weirton to stand with our steel workers.

WATCH: The Ohio River Valley in West Virginia & Ohio has produced the steel that built America into the superpower it is today. We must protect these critical jobs. I’m glad @SenSherrodBrown joined me in Weirton today to thank our steelworkers for continuing this proud legacy.

I’m at Cleveland-Cliffs’ Weirton facility w/ @SenSherrodBrown to see this world-class facility in action & see firsthand how dumped tin mill product from abroad is impacting domestic steel production. I will continue to fight to protect American jobs from unfair trade practices.

#WV's Northern Panhandle has a storied legacy of producing the world's best steel. I'm proud to join USW 2911 President Mark Glyptis, Weirton Mayor Harold "Bubba" Miller, and city & county officials in Weirton today to thank our steelworkers for all that they do for our country.

The IRA isn’t a red bill or a blue bill, & it sure isn’t a green bill. It’s an American bill. It accounts for the reality that our economy & everyday Americans will rely on fossil fuels for the foreseeable future while also diversifying energy sources @WSJ energy.senate.gov/2023/9/man…
Gayle & I wish an easy & meaningful fast to all West Virginians observing the Day of Atonement, Yom Kippur.

Today, I had the honor of meeting pipeliners from across the country at the Pipeliners Local 798 regional meeting at the Charleston Convention Center. We all owe these men & women a debt of gratitude because they are the “MVPs” building the Mountain Valley Pipeline!

Today is National Hunting and Fishing Day! Join me in celebrating West Virginia’s rich sporting heritage. We are truly blessed to have some of the best hunting and angling in the world right here in our backyard.

I was proud to join my Senate colleagues today for a meeting with @ZelenskyyUa. As the world’s beacon of hope and freedom, America must stand strongly with the brave people of Ukraine as they defend their country against Russian aggression & fight for democracy.

Today, the Senate unanimously passed my bipartisan resolution recognizing September as Childhood Cancer Awareness Month. I am proud to help raise awareness around childhood cancer and the lives it affects every day. MORE: sen.gov/MPJ3

I encourage all WV fourth-graders to submit an essay on why they love #WV’s forests and public lands. One lucky winner will win a trip to Washington, DC for the lighting of the U.S. Capitol Christmas Tree – which is from right here in WV this year! uscapitolchristmastree.com/e…

Today is #NationalVoterRegistrationDay! Are you registered to #vote? The right to vote is fundamental to our American democracy. I encourage all West Virginians who are eligible to vote to ensure their registration is up-to-date. Visit govotewv.com to register to vote.

ICYMI: The only thing around here that seems to be bipartisan is both sides want to spend more money. We can’t spend our way out of nearly $33T in national debt. A deal is a deal — we passed the Fiscal Responsibility Act with bipartisan support. We have to stop this runaway train

Today I visited Sailors aboard the USS Abraham Lincoln to thank them for their service to our great country. It’s truly awe-inspiring seeing the readiness & capabilities our nation has to defend our country anywhere in the world.

The Mothman Festival kicks off this weekend in Point Pleasant! Visit mothmanfestival.com/ to learn more about this unique festival that celebrates one of #WV's most famous cryptids.

That tragic day 22 years ago is forever seared into our memories. Today especially, we honor those who lost their lives on September 11th, the families who still mourn them, the brave first responders and our service members who answered the call that day and in the aftermath.

Without truck drivers, we wouldn't have the food, products and raw materials that our nation depends on every day. Truck drivers keep West Virginia and America moving forward. Please join me in thanking our truck drivers for their tireless work! #NTDAW23

On this #LaborDay, thank the hardworking West Virginians who work every day to keep the lights on, educate our children, improve our economy and keep our communities safe and healthy. May God bless our workers, and may God bless the Great State of West Virginia!

WATCH: We have been able to succeed in this country over the past four years under the most difficult and divided of times. Just think of what we could accomplish if we put politics aside and sat down and worked together to move our state and our country forward?

GOOD NEWS: I'm proud to announce more than $8.7 MILLION from @TheJusticeDept for three programs dedicated to promoting public safety and protecting West Virginians. MORE: sen.gov/W3VM

West Virginia is America’s Energy MVP, not only because we power our nation, but also because we demonstrate that when we work together, we can accomplish great things for our country.

The Mountain Valley Pipeline allows us to get more of the abundant natural resources we’re blessed with to the rest of the country— strengthening America’s energy security and lowering energy costs for families.
WATCH: This week, I visited Summers County to tour a construction site for the Mountain Valley Pipeline. To see West Virginians hard at work on this pipeline fills me with pride and excitement.

No family should have to choose between life-saving medication and putting food on their table or a roof over their heads. I will continue working to ensure the #InflationReductionAct is implemented correctly to reduce costs for folks across the country. sen.gov/JM9Y

Thanks to the #InflationReductionAct, drug costs for millions of families across the USA are on their way down. In addition to allowing Medicare price negotiations for drugs like Eliquis & Xarelto, the IRA caps Medicare recipients’ insulin cost at $35/mo. sen.gov/JM9Y
Gayle and I are praying for a successful and speedy recovery for our friend @SteveScalise as he begins treatment.
He was generous with his time and wisdom. That kindness meant so much to Gayle and me. Our prayers are with the entire Nutting family and everyone who has been impacted by Ogden’s kindness.

I first met Ogden Nutting nearly 30 years ago when I was a young politician with big ideas for West Virginia. He held his papers to impeccable standards and asked tough questions. But we quickly bonded over our love and commitment to West Virginia.

WATCH: This week, I traveled to Fayette County to celebrate more than $3.7 BILLION in federal funding to the New River Gorge region since @NewRiverNPS's redesignation in January 2021. I was proud to secure this funding, which is making huge impacts on this region and our state.

Since the designation of the New River Gorge National Park & Preserve in 2021, I have secured $1.85B in federal funding for Raleigh County, $921M for Fayette County, $585M for Nicholas County and $315M for Summers County — including about $51M in Congressionally Directed Spending

Today I’m at @NewRiverNPS to celebrate more than $3.7 BILLION in federal funding to the New River Gorge Region since the park’s redesignation in January 2021! As @EnergyDems Chairman, I worked hard to designate New River Gorge as a National Park, & this work is paying off for WV.

WATCH: I was proud to secure $4.5M in funding for the Raleigh County Memorial Airport Industrial Park expansion. This is the only park in WV where a corporation can have their business offices & corporate aircraft on the same site — ready to travel anywhere in the country. @WVVA

This historic investment in Raleigh County Memorial Airport will provide local businesses with access to new markets. Through a partnership with @newriverctc, we will increase the supply of skilled labor for #WV’s aerospace industry - a win-win for businesses & West Virginians.

I’m thrilled to be in Beckley today to celebrate the groundbreaking of the Raleigh County Memorial Airport Industrial Park expansion project. This monumental investment - which I secured $4.5M in federal investments for - will develop 105 acres of site-ready property.
Special thanks to my friend @BradPaisley for performing at the grand reopening of Herbert Hoover High School. His dedication to the state makes me proud to be a West Virginian.

It was a true honor to be a part of the Ribbon Cutting Ceremony for Herbert Hoover HS. West Virginians came together to make this beautiful & state-of-the-art school possible, & I am so proud of how we overcame the odds to create lasting change for our students & our community.
Don’t miss the final weekend of the @SFWV! Enjoy the local food, music, and other great #WV traditions.

Today, my family and I visited @WVUKids for the unveiling of my locker located in the Hostetler Family Resource Center.

Gayle & I are proud to be a part of the Center to help ensure every family can have some peace of mind and a place of refuge while their child is in recovery.
My statement on the one-year anniversary of the signing of the Inflation Reduction Act.

Upgrading and improving our pipeline infrastructure is critical as West Virginia continues to fuel our nation’s energy needs, and I’m pleased @USDOT is investing more than $545K to bolster pipeline safety programs across our state. MORE: sen.gov/OR3X

This week, Gayle and I had the chance to tour Gayle’s childhood home. From the colorful kitchen lights to the vintage wood paneling, it brought back many wonderful memories. I am thankful that @WVU_Tech invited us back home. Beckley will always have a special place in our hearts.
My statement on Fitch Ratings’ decision to downgrade the U.S. credit rating from AAA to AA+:

I was proud to secure $6 MILLION in Congressionally Directed Spending to further enhance @WVSOM’s ability to conduct critical research and train our next generation of medical professionals.

#ICYMI: I am a proud cosponsor of @SenSherrodBrown’s legislation to make our flags right here in America. We are one step closer to getting it done! wkbn.com/news/ohio/ohio-sena…

Scouting helped make me who I am today, and I am thankful that boys and girls from across the country and around the world now have the opportunity to come to @BechtelSummit in West Virginia to learn valuable life lessons and enjoy our little slice of Almost Heaven.

I had a trip down memory lane today at Camp Mountaineer in Monongalia County. Some of my most fond childhood memories & lasting friendships were made right here. I FaceTimed my childhood best friend, Chip, to show him Seneca Camp, where we pitched our tents many years ago.

The American flag is a symbol of the freedoms and values that we hold dear & our Veterans have fought for defend. I’m proud to join @SenSherrodBrown in sponsoring a bill that will require the federal government to buy only American-made flags 🇺🇸 wkbn.com/news/ohio/ohio-sena…

WATCH: Construction of the Mountain Valley Pipeline will now resume, creating 4,500 jobs by the end of August. This is a great day for American energy security and even a greater day for the state of West Virginia.

I’ve said it before and I’ll keep saying it: there truly is no better place to do business than West Virginia. The approval for this final permit is great news for @NucorCorp and our state, and I can’t wait to see the benefits this new facility will bring to West Virginia.

GOOD NEWS: @NucorCorp has received a Section 404 permit for construction of its state-of-the-art steel mill in Mason County! This is a significant milestone in this multi-billion dollar investment I helped secure for our state.

The Senate Appropriations Committee has now reported all 12 bipartisan annual appropriations bills for the first time since 2018. I'm proud we passed these funding bills on time to deliver these crucial resources to West Virginia. sen.gov/Y560

These funding bills include more than $154 MILLION earmarked for specific West Virginia projects, including $2.5 million for the WV Bureau of Senior Services, which was conceptualized after my “Serving Our Seniors” tour to all 55 counties across West Virginia.

GOOD NEWS: We advanced bipartisan appropriations bills that provide funding to #WV for some of the state’s top priorities: combatting the drug epidemic, supporting coal communities, preserving our public lands & defending our nation. MORE: sen.gov/Y560
I urge my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to support this vital bipartisan legislation to help address the drug epidemic facing our nation. sen.gov/RX2P

The bipartisan Life Budgeting for Opioid Addiction Treatment (LifeBOAT) Act would establish a stewardship fee to provide and expand access to substance use treatment. This would help our communities invest in life-saving resources for our fellow Americans in need.

It is past time that funding meets the need for resources, treatment facilities & healthcare providers that help Americans struggling with substance use disorder. That's why I'm proud to join @SenatorRomney in reintroducing the bipartisan LifeBOAT Act. sen.gov/RX2P

Finally, the United States is going to start taking care of its own and producing the enriched uranium we need. I thank my colleagues for their overwhelming support for this amendment which will bolster our national security.

The Supreme Court has spoken and this decision to let construction of the Mountain Valley Pipeline move forward again is the correct one. I am relieved that the highest court in the land has upheld the law Congress passed and the President signed.

My bipartisan Protecting Athletes, Schools, and Sports (PASS) Act of 2023 is the culmination of a year-long initiative to create commonsense guidelines for the NIL system that will benefit our student-athletes and #WV’s colleges & universities. MORE: sen.gov/3L17

WATCH: Continued energy production on federal lands and waters is incredibly beneficial, but I have been concerned about efforts by the Administration to throttle back oil and gas leasing and production.

💊 Lowers the cost of prescription drugs, capping the price of insulin at $35.
💉 Provides free vaccines for seniors under Medicare.
